bug.author: frenando
bug.summary: spaCy loops indefinetly during parsing of a typo ridden sentence
bug.description:
While trying to parse a large file with multiple tweets I found one which is completely typo ridden (using punctuation instead of spaces, mispellings, etc.), this specific text chain causes spaCy tokenizer to loop indefinetly. <denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
import spacy nlp = spacy.load("es_core_news_sm") doc = nlp(u'Me pongo alas vivas.por favor vendan alitas.de pavo.piernas.huacales.crudos.va.colitas.rostizadas.como.en.cd.juarez.chihuagua.va.gracias.') <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Windows 10-10.0.1734-SP0 Python Version Used: 3.6.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.11 Environment Information: Models: "es"

comments.comment: Thanks for the example! We need to make a test case for this, and then look into it.
Just tested this with the new spacy-nightly and the new models and it works as expected now. This was likely related to an issue with the TOKEN_MATCH, which was resolved for the new version.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
